notes: Upon cast, kills the target unit instantly and grants the caster 160 unreliable gold and 2.1 of the target's experience bounty.
The target's default bounties are not granted. This means that no hero nearby gains the default gold and experience from the death.
Despite the visual effects, the gold and experience are granted instantly.

Deals damage equal to the target's current health to kill it. This damage fully ignores any form of reduction or amplification. This means that it triggers most on-damage events like (neutral or lane) creep aggro.

Cannot be cast on wards, buildings, ancient creeps, Necronomicon Warriors, and Necronomicon Archers.
abilities.description: Kills a non-hero target for 160 gold and 2.1x experience. Cannot be used on Ancient Creeps.

name: Hand of Midas
description: Preserved through unknown magical means, the Hand of Midas is a weapon of greed, sacrificing animals to line the owner's pockets.
trivia: Midas is based on Midas, a figure from Greek mythology who turned all he touched to gold.
tips: The earlier Hand of Midas is purchased, the earlier it will pay itself off during the match and the earlier you will have an effective networth gain. Assuming it is always used when off cooldown and used on a unit with a gold bounty of 0, Hand of Midas increases the user's GPM by 106.67 , meaning it takes a minimum of 19.5 minutes to pay for itself, or 15 minutes for the recipe (from the point on it was first used). This means you need to use Transmute 13.75 times to pay for itself, or 10.94 times for just the recipe. Ogre Magi with his Multicast and Arc Warden Tempest Double will have their Hand of Midas payed out effectively earlier than other heroes.
